subject: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: Since this seems a hot topic, I would like to throw in Eckel s 5-2-03 Strong Typing vs. Strong Testing article into the mix
messageBody:
Since this seems a hot topic, I would like to throw in Eckel's "5-2-03
Strong Typing vs. Strong Testing" article into the mix
(http://www.mindview.net/WebLog/log-0025)
-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of
Cédric Beust ?
Sent: Tuesday, February 07, 2006 11:25 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re:
Observations from a production use of JUnit4)


On 2/7/06, Daryl Richter <daryl@...> wrote:
>
>
> > So is mine, and they're both plagued by this problem.
>
> C'mon Cedric. Have you really done serious Smalltalk coding? I am
> not implying there weren't challenges, but this was *never* one of
> them.


Because back then, nobody minded doing refactoring with string replaces...

The requirements and expectations today are quite more stringent.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
